intro: Wendlandia orientalis, commonly known as the oriental bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its striking appearance and relatively easy care make it a favored plant among gardeners and botanists alike.
